alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and hail of 1 to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots and hail of 1 to 2 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area.

Thunderstorms southeast of Pelee Island are moving towards the northwest at roughly 30 knots.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately.

alerts.headline: squall warning ended
alerts.description:
Squalls have weakened or moved out of the area.


###

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Dense fog has developed and as a result near zero visibility is expected through the overnight period.

###

Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
###

Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: fog advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Dense fog has developed and as a result near zero visibility is expected through early this morning.

###

Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: fog advisory ended
alerts.description:
Visibilities have improved and are no longer expected to meet fog advisory criteria.


###

alerts.headline: squall watch in effect
alerts.description:
Conditions are favourable for the development of squalls with wind gusts up to 40 knots.

Thunderstorms may affect portions of eastern Lake Ontario and the St. Lawrence River this afternoon and early evening.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for potential squalls. Vulnerable vessels are most at risk and should seek safe harbour if underway.
